entry.title: Week 48, 2025: Package ecosystem growth with opam 2.5.0 release, email protocol stack updates, and OCaml 5.4 compatibility work
entry.content:
New Features

  • opam 2.5.0 package manager released with 8 component packages by Kate (ocaml/opam-repository#28978)
  • cmdliner 2.1.0 command-line interface library added by Daniel Bünzli (ocaml/opam-repository#28962)
  • conf-libclang versions 19 and 21 support added using generic configure script by Marcello Seri and Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28968, ocaml/opam-repository#28950)
  • OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility bounds added for bogue, why3, and boltzgen packages by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28974, ocaml/opam-repository#28973, ocaml/opam-repository#28971)
  • MSys2 support improvements with fixed side-conditions for conf-packages by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28944)
  • Cross-platform build tools with opam-build and opam-test 0.3.0 releases by Kate (ocaml/opam-repository#28967)
  • Fixed typos in OCaml.org tutorial documentation for Maps and Sets modules by Rong "Mantle" Bao (ocaml/ocaml.org#3399)
  • Updated CI workflow to use actions/checkout@v6 across all GitHub Actions workflows by Dependabot (ocaml/ocaml.org#3401)

    • Group Overview

  • Package ecosystem expansion with comprehensive email protocol stack updates from Calascibetta Romain covering SMTP, MIME, DKIM, DMARC, ARC, and SPF libraries (ocaml/opam-repository#28992, ocaml/opam-repository#28991, ocaml/opam-repository#28982, ocaml/opam-repository#28995, ocaml/opam-repository#28980, ocaml/opam-repository#28996)
  • Major tooling releases including opam 2.5.0 by Kate (ocaml/opam-repository#28978) and cmdliner 2.1.0 by Daniel Bünzli (ocaml/opam-repository#28962)
  • OCaml 5.4.0 preparation accelerating with compatibility bounds and dependency fixes by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28974, ocaml/opam-repository#28973, ocaml/opam-repository#28971)
  • Melange ecosystem activity with open PRs for Melange 6.0.1, reason 3.17.2, and melange-fetch updates by Antonio Nuno Monteiro and David Sancho (ocaml/opam-repository#29001, ocaml/opam-repository#28999, ocaml/opam-repository#28990)
  • OCaml.org content updates with five new blog posts added to OCaml Planet and tutorial documentation improvements (ocaml/ocaml.org#3400, ocaml/ocaml.org#3402, ocaml/ocaml.org#3403, ocaml/ocaml.org#3404, ocaml/ocaml.org#3399)
  • Cross-platform configuration improvements with MSys2 fixes, new conf-libclang versions, and distribution-specific depext refinements by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28944, ocaml/opam-repository#28968, ocaml/opam-repository#28976, ocaml/opam-repository#28989)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Package publication and documentation pipeline operates between ocaml/opam-repository for package releases and ocaml/ocaml.org for blog announcements and tutorials, with opam 2.5.0 release in repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28978) likely to be featured in future OCaml.org content
  • OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility preparation work in opam-repository by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28974, ocaml/opam-repository#28973, ocaml/opam-repository#28971) supports OCaml.org blog posts on ARM32 support discussed in Planet aggregation (ocaml/ocaml.org#3404)
  • Tutorial documentation improvements on OCaml.org (ocaml/ocaml.org#3399) complement package availability in opam-repository, ensuring users can discover and learn about Maps and Sets functionality
  • CI infrastructure alignment with GitHub Actions updates to v6 on OCaml.org (ocaml/ocaml.org#3401) and opam-ci infrastructure discussions for opam-repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28966)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Periodic archival run planning discussed by Hannes Mehnert for December snapshot with archival tool run, PR preparation, and testing repository until January deadline (ocaml/opam-repository#28489)
  • rocq-prover versioning confusion raised by Ralf Jung where rocq-prover.9.0.0 package actually installs Rocq 9.1 due to unpinned dependencies (ocaml/opam-repository#28994)
  • CI source fetching failures investigated by Jan Midtgaard for alt-ergo.1.01 and cmdliner.2.0.0 with curl exit code 6 errors on opam-ci workers affecting self-hosted packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28966)
  • Distribution wiki documentation enhancement requested by Jan Midtgaard to add NixOS, Rocky Linux, and Linux Mint distribution entries plus correct Ubuntu os-family value (ocaml/opam-repository#28930)
  • Windows mingw-w64-shims installation issue resolved and closed by Lukasz Stafiniak after intermittent permission errors stopped occurring (ocaml/opam-repository#27717)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Email and authentication protocol stack reaching production maturity with coordinated releases of DKIM, DMARC, ARC, SPF validation, and SMTP/MIME libraries forming comprehensive email infrastructure from Calascibetta Romain (ocaml/opam-repository#28982, ocaml/opam-repository#28995, ocaml/opam-repository#28996, ocaml/opam-repository#28980, ocaml/opam-repository#28992, ocaml/opam-repository#28991)
  • OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem preparation accelerating with proactive upper bound additions and dependency fixes ensuring smooth transition by Jan Midtgaard (ocaml/opam-repository#28974, ocaml/opam-repository#28973, ocaml/opam-repository#28971)
  • Cross-platform configuration improvements continuing with MSys2 side-condition fixes, new conf-libclang versions supporting LLVM 19 and 21, and distribution-specific depext refinements by Jan Midtgaard and Marcello Seri (ocaml/opam-repository#28944, ocaml/opam-repository#28968, ocaml/opam-repository#28950, ocaml/opam-repository#28976, ocaml/opam-repository#28989)
  • Melange ecosystem growth with new releases of melange-fetch, quickjs bindings, server-reason-react, and upcoming Melange 6.0.1 by Antonio Nuno Monteiro and David Sancho (ocaml/opam-repository#28990, ocaml/opam-repository#29000, ocaml/opam-repository#29006, ocaml/opam-repository#29001)
  • Package maintenance infrastructure discussions around archival process, versioning clarity, and CI reliability improvements reflecting repository maturity (ocaml/opam-repository#28489, ocaml/opam-repository#28994, ocaml/opam-repository#28966)
  • Automated content aggregation maintaining steady flow of community blog posts to OCaml.org Planet covering technical topics and ecosystem developments (ocaml/ocaml.org#3400, ocaml/ocaml.org#3402, ocaml/ocaml.org#3403, ocaml/ocaml.org#3404)
entry.summary: Package ecosystem growth with opam 2.5.0 release, email protocol stack updates, and OCaml 5.4 compatibility work

entry.title: Week 47, 2025: opam 2.5.0-rc1 published with 36 packages merged; documentation improvements and Windows platform support expanded
entry.content:
New Features

  • avro-simple 0.1 provides pure OCaml Apache Avro implementation with codec-based design, schema evolution support, and container file format (ocaml/opam-repository#28910)
  • salto-analyzer 0.2 introduces OCaml static analyzer based on abstract interpretation for inferring output values and exceptions (ocaml/opam-repository#28917)
  • expr 1.0.0 new package for parsing and evaluating arithmetic expressions (ocaml/opam-repository#28905)
  • alice 0.1.1 new package added to repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28941)
  • yocaml 2.7.0 static site generator gains Liquid templating language support across 14 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28919)
  • ocaml-protoc 4.0 brings better parsing, validation code generation, and presence semantics handling for Protocol Buffers (ocaml/opam-repository#28902)
  • crowbar 0.2.2 QuickCheck-style property testing library enhanced with afl-fuzz integration (ocaml/opam-repository#28907)
  • qcow 0.12.2 adds support for Qcow2 image format with upstream diet package integration (ocaml/opam-repository#28936)
  • goblint-cil 2.0.9 C front-end updated with __loop_condition labels support (ocaml/opam-repository#28929)
  • bstr 0.0.3 bigstring library resolves SIGSEGV issues and improves encoding functionality (ocaml/opam-repository#28933)
  • msvs-detect 0.8.0 adds Visual Studio 2026 support for Windows developers (ocaml/opam-repository#28940)
  • hol2dk 2.1.0 translator updated for HOL-Light to Dedukti/Lambdapi and Rocq conversion (ocaml/opam-repository#28937)
  • albatross 2.6.1 MirageOS unikernel orchestration system updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28915)
  • ca-certs-nss 3.118 Mozilla NSS certificate bundle updated to latest version (ocaml/opam-repository#28924)
  • lun 0.0.2 optics library for OCaml released across 2 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28927)
  • Unison 2.53.8 file synchronization tool updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28851)
  • smtml 0.14.0 SMT solver frontend released (ocaml/opam-repository#28913)
  • fit 1.4.0 gains 32-bit architecture support (ocaml/opam-repository#28904)
  • query-json 0.5.52 jq implementation in OCaml updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28909)
  • opam-publish 2.7.1 tool for publishing to opam-repository updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28920)
  • crypt 2.1 cryptography package updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28906)
  • css 0.4.0 CSS parsing library updated (ocaml/opam-repository#28870)
  • ojs_base 0.9.0 base library for OCaml web applications updated across 6 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28882)
  • MSys2 platform support massively improved with side-condition fixes across 20+ conf-packages including cairo, freetype, gtk2, gtk3, postgresql, SDL2, sqlite3, zlib, and zstd (ocaml/opam-repository#28939, ocaml/opam-repository#28945)
  • Rocky Linux 9 support added for conf-openblas package installation (ocaml/opam-repository#28925)
  • NixOS support fixed for conf-oniguruma package (ocaml/opam-repository#28921)
  • lablgtk3 Windows hotfixes applied for better Windows platform support (ocaml/opam-repository#28918)
  • Archiving policy documentation enhanced with summary section clarifying maintenance requirements: packages must have available sources, be installable on at least one platform with OCaml 4.08+, and have maintenance intent metadata (ocaml/opam-repository#28922)
  • Package metadata improvements with x-maintenance-intent fields added across 57 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28908)
  • GitHub Actions upgraded from actions/checkout v5 to v6 in opam-repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28943)
  • Documentation generation tutorial enhancement on ocaml.org with new dune ocaml doc command shortcut that automatically builds and opens documentation in the browser (ocaml/ocaml.org#3391)
  • Video scraper buffer fix on ocaml.org addressing YAML serialization failures when processing large numbers of videos by increasing output buffer from 256KB to 2MB, accommodating growth to ~1500 videos (ocaml/ocaml.org#3392)

    • Group Overview

  • opam 2.5.0 release candidate published across both repositories with Kate releasing the package in ocaml/opam-repository#28928 and adding the changelog announcement to ocaml.org in ocaml/ocaml.org#3395
  • 36 packages merged into ocaml/opam-repository including new implementations for Apache Avro, static analysis, templating engines, and numerous library updates
  • Windows and cross-platform support significantly expanded with Jan Midtgaard leading MSys2 fixes across 20+ conf-packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28939, ocaml/opam-repository#28945), plus Rocky Linux 9 and NixOS support additions
  • Documentation and infrastructure improvements on ocaml/ocaml.org with sabine enhancing the documentation generation tutorial (ocaml/ocaml.org#3391) and fixing video scraper reliability issues (ocaml/ocaml.org#3392)
  • Automated content aggregation brought in 13 new blog posts and videos covering OCaml developments across the ecosystem (ocaml/ocaml.org#3398, ocaml/ocaml.org#3397)
  • Repository maintenance advanced with archiving policy documentation clarifications (ocaml/opam-repository#28922) and x-maintenance-intent metadata added to 57 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28908)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • opam 2.5.0 release coordination with Kate publishing the release candidate package in ocaml/opam-repository#28928 and adding the corresponding changelog and announcement to ocaml/ocaml.org#3395, with sabine reviewing the ocaml.org PR to ensure consistency
  • Content aggregation workflow on ocaml/ocaml.org includes automated scraping of blog posts and videos that reference package releases from ocaml/opam-repository, ensuring the community stays informed about ecosystem developments (ocaml/ocaml.org#3398, ocaml/ocaml.org#3397)
  • Documentation improvements on ocaml/ocaml.org by sabine enhance the developer experience for generating documentation for packages distributed through ocaml/opam-repository (ocaml/ocaml.org#3391)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Archiving policy refinement in ocaml/opam-repository resolved with Stephen Dolan and maintainers agreeing that packages can retain commented-out code sections (ocaml/opam-repository#24501) and establishing available: false as the mechanism for marking non-functional packages for archival (ocaml/opam-repository#23697), with summary documentation added to policies (ocaml/opam-repository#28922)
  • System package installation behavior discussed in ocaml/opam-repository by Jan Midtgaard regarding differences between Debian and Centos/OpenSuse in handling missing depexts constraints (ocaml/opam-repository#28953)
  • MSys2 compilation issues identified in ocaml/opam-repository with Jan Midtgaard reporting topkg.1.1.0 failure related to findlib package (ocaml/opam-repository#28636)
  • Distribution documentation expansion requested in ocaml/opam-repository by Jan Midtgaard to include NixOS, Rocky, and Mint in wiki table (ocaml/opam-repository#28930)
  • Periodic archival scheduling considered in ocaml/opam-repository by Hannes Mehnert with discussion of minimal OCaml version requirements (ocaml/opam-repository#28489)
  • opam 2.0 workflow issues documented in ocaml/opam-repository by Jan Midtgaard regarding timeouts and cyclic dependency errors (ocaml/opam-repository#28952)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Windows platform support intensification in ocaml/opam-repository with Jan Midtgaard leading systematic MSys2 side-condition fixes across 20+ conf-packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28939, ocaml/opam-repository#28944, ocaml/opam-repository#28945), David Allsopp adding Visual Studio 2026 support (ocaml/opam-repository#28940) and lablgtk3 hotfixes (ocaml/opam-repository#28918)
  • Maintenance intent metadata adoption accelerating in ocaml/opam-repository with 57 packages updated by @redianthus to include x-maintenance-intent fields (ocaml/opam-repository#28908), supporting repository archiving policy implementation
  • Linux distribution support expansion in ocaml/opam-repository with Török Edwin fixing Rocky Linux 9 (ocaml/opam-repository#28925), Ryan Gibb addressing NixOS packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28921, ocaml/opam-repository#28931), demonstrating broader distribution coverage
  • MirageOS ecosystem sustained development in ocaml/opam-repository with Hannes Mehnert updating albatross (ocaml/opam-repository#28915) and ca-certs-nss (ocaml/opam-repository#28924), Pau Ruiz Safont releasing qcow (ocaml/opam-repository#28936), Reynir Björnsson submitting mirage (ocaml/opam-repository#28942)
  • Web development tooling growth in ocaml/opam-repository with Xavier Van de Woestyne releasing yocaml static site generator (ocaml/opam-repository#28919), Ben Faerber submitting liquid-ml templating (ocaml/opam-repository#28951), Yawar Amin updating dream-html (ocaml/opam-repository#28954), @hirrolot adding mazeppa (ocaml/opam-repository#28949), Zoggy releasing ojs_base and css (ocaml/opam-repository#28882, ocaml/opam-repository#28870)
  • Static analysis and verification advancing in ocaml/opam-repository with Benoit Montagu releasing salto-analyzer (ocaml/opam-repository#28917), Frédéric Blanqui updating hol2dk (ocaml/opam-repository#28937), ongoing Frama-C ecosystem work (ocaml/opam-repository#28843, ocaml/opam-repository#28841)
  • Data format and protocol support expanding in ocaml/opam-repository with Tim McGilchrist contributing Apache Avro implementation (ocaml/opam-repository#28910), Simon Cruanes enhancing Protocol Buffers support (ocaml/opam-repository#28902), Pau Ruiz Safont adding Qcow2 image support (ocaml/opam-repository#28936)
  • OCaml 5.0+ adoption progressing in ocaml/opam-repository with new packages requiring effects (ocaml/opam-repository#28955, ocaml/opam-repository#28910) and compatibility work for existing libraries (ocaml/opam-repository#28849)
  • Automated content scraping continues on ocaml/ocaml.org to be a core workflow for keeping the OCaml Planet aggregator up-to-date with community blog posts and videos, with infrastructure improvements ensuring reliability as content volume grows (ocaml/ocaml.org#3392)
  • Documentation tooling enhancements on ocaml/ocaml.org showing attention to developer experience improvements, making it easier for OCaml developers to generate and view documentation (ocaml/ocaml.org#3391)
  • Routine dependency maintenance through automated Dependabot PRs keeping GitHub Actions workflows current with latest tooling versions across both repositories (ocaml/opam-repository#28943, ocaml/ocaml.org#3396)
entry.summary: opam 2.5.0-rc1 published with 36 packages merged; documentation improvements and Windows platform support expanded

entry.title: Week 46, 2025: OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 released with 43 packages merged including Catala 1.0.0, WebAssembly tooling, and cross-platform improvements
entry.content:
New Features

  • OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 released with 8 core packages (opam-client, opam-core, opam-devel, opam-format, opam-installer, opam-repository, opam-solver, opam-state) by Kate (ocaml/opam-repository#28877), with changelog added to ocaml/ocaml.org (ocaml/ocaml.org#3395)
  • Catala 1.0.0 legal programming language reached production milestone (ocaml/opam-repository#28853)
  • OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 adds support for OCaml 5.4.0 and Unikraft 0.20.0 with 19 updated packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28750)
  • Frama-C 32.0~beta (Germanium) introduces ANSI color terminal support, improved C23 alignment directives, and new \aligned predicate in ACSL (ocaml/opam-repository#28842)
  • libdrm 0.1 initial release provides OCaml bindings for Direct Rendering Manager (ocaml/opam-repository#28883)
  • raga 0.1.0 new static site generator with Handlebars templating by Kaustubh Maske Patil (ocaml/opam-repository#28847)
  • handlebars-ml 0.3.0 brings Handlebars.js templating to OCaml (ocaml/opam-repository#28846)
  • jsonfeed 1.1.0 parser for JSON Feed specification by Anil Madhavapeddy (ocaml/opam-repository#28884)
  • crockford 1.0.0 implements Crockford Base32 encoding (ocaml/opam-repository#28885)
  • tsdl 1.2.0 adds preferred locales support and message box fixes for SDL2 bindings (ocaml/opam-repository#28878)
  • ctypes 0.24.0 foreign function interface library update (ocaml/opam-repository#28855)
  • patch 3.1.0 performance improvements using rope data structure (ocaml/opam-repository#28854)
  • moonpool 0.10 thread/domain pools with breaking changes (removed around_task and moonpool.fib) (ocaml/opam-repository#28891)
  • ansifmt 2.0.0 complete rewrite using rich-string for ANSI terminal styling (ocaml/opam-repository#28803)
  • visitors.20251114 syntax extension for generating visitor classes by François Pottier (ocaml/opam-repository#28893)
  • pcre2-ocaml 8.0.4 with upstream fixes (ocaml/opam-repository#28879)
  • qcaml 0.1.4 quantum computing simulation library (ocaml/opam-repository#28840)
  • dkml-c-probe 3.2.0 cross-compiler ABI discovery tool (ocaml/opam-repository#28864)
  • rfsm 2.2 StateChart-like state diagram library (ocaml/opam-repository#28889)
  • climate 0.9.0 CLI parsing improvements (ocaml/opam-repository#28872)
  • crypt 2.0 high-level cryptography API (ocaml/opam-repository#28875)
  • ocf 1.0.0 and ocf_ppx 1.0.0 for JSON configuration files (ocaml/opam-repository#28868)
  • xtmpl 1.2.0 XML templating suite with 3 packages (xtmpl, xtmpljs, xtmplppx) (ocaml/opam-repository#28869)
  • ojsbase 0.9.0 suite of 6 packages for OCaml web apps with websockets and jsof_ocaml (ocaml/opam-repository#28882)
  • ppxderivingjsont 0.1.1 adds OCaml 4.14 compatibility (ocaml/opam-repository#28874)
  • binaryen WebAssembly tooling with 9 packages released: libbinaryen 122.0.1, 123.0.1, 124.0.1 and binaryen 0.32.0, 0.33.0, 0.34.0 by Oscar Spencer (ocaml/opam-repository#28859, ocaml/opam-repository#28860, ocaml/opam-repository#28861, ocaml/opam-repository#28880, ocaml/opam-repository#28887, ocaml/opam-repository#28888)
  • logs 0.10.0 logging library update, bytesrw 0.3.0 bytes readers and writers library, bitstring 5.0.2 pattern matching for binary data, directories 0.7 platform-appropriate standard directories, and elpi 3.4.3 embeddable lambda-Prolog interpreter merged (ocaml/opam-repository#fe2b824)

    • Group Overview

  • The ecosystem group coordinated the OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 release across ocaml/opam-repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28877) and ocaml/ocaml.org (ocaml/ocaml.org#3395), with Kate releasing 8 core packages and documenting the release on the website
  • 43 packages merged in ocaml/opam-repository spanning infrastructure tools, WebAssembly tooling, data format libraries, web development frameworks, and specialized domain applications
  • Cross-platform improvements delivered through MSYS2/Cygwin CI fixes (ocaml/opam-repository#28897, ocaml/opam-repository#28856), OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support (ocaml/opam-repository#28750), and Android/Termux support discussions (ocaml/opam-repository#28871)
  • Beta testing cycle underway with OPAM 2.5.0~beta1, Lwt 6.0.0-beta01 (ocaml/opam-repository#28894), and Frama-C 32.0~beta (ocaml/opam-repository#28842) entering simultaneous testing
  • Repository maintenance focused on infrastructure quality with URL migrations (ocaml/opam-repository#28896), constraint corrections (ocaml/opam-repository#28805), and x-maintenance-intent field adoption across multiple PRs

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 release coordination between ocaml/opam-repository and ocaml/ocaml.org by Kate, releasing 8 packages (ocaml/opam-repository#28877) and documenting the release with a changelog PR (ocaml/ocaml.org#3395)
  • Revdep testing fallout from OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 requiring odoc-driver upper bound fix by Anil Madhavapeddy (ocaml/opam-repository#28890)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Android/Termux OCaml support discussion in ocaml/opam-repository#28871 where a developer sought help installing packages with a custom OCaml 5.5.0+dev compiler built from source, Kate provided guidance on using ocaml-system package via temporary repository (ocaml/opam-repository#28455) but revealed platform limitations including lwt Android incompatibility and ocamlformat lacking OCaml trunk support
  • MSYS2/Cygwin toolchain compatibility discussion in ocaml/opam-repository#28851 for Unison where David Allsopp clarified that Cairo/lablgtk issues affect MSVC only, not MSYS2, leading to proper constraint recommendations
  • x-maintenance-intent field requests appearing across multiple PRs (ocaml/opam-repository#28847, ocaml/opam-repository#28879, ocaml/opam-repository#28893) as repository maintainers encourage adoption of archiving policy

    • Emerging Trends

  • Beta release coordination across infrastructure with OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 (ocaml/opam-repository#28877), Lwt 6.0.0-beta01 (ocaml/opam-repository#28894), and Frama-C 32.0~beta (ocaml/opam-repository#28842) entering testing phase simultaneously, indicating ecosystem-wide preparation for updates
  • WebAssembly ecosystem expansion demonstrated by 9 binaryen package releases from Oscar Spencer tracking upstream versions 122-124 (ocaml/opam-repository#28859, ocaml/opam-repository#28860, ocaml/opam-repository#28861, ocaml/opam-repository#28880, ocaml/opam-repository#28887, ocaml/opam-repository#28888), reflecting OCaml's growing WebAssembly capabilities
  • Cross-platform reach extending through Android/Termux support discussions (ocaml/opam-repository#28871), MSYS2/Cygwin CI improvements (ocaml/opam-repository#28856, ocaml/opam-repository#28897), 32-bit architecture support (fit 1.4.0 ocaml/opam-repository#28904), and OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 unikernel support (ocaml/opam-repository#28750)
  • Quality improvements in CI infrastructure catching LLVM 19 compatibility issues early (conf-libclang failures in ocaml/opam-repository#28843), URL migration preventing curl failures (ocaml/opam-repository#28896), and systematic constraint corrections (ocaml/opam-repository#28805)
  • Documentation standardization with recurring x-maintenance-intent field requests across ocaml/opam-repository#28847, ocaml/opam-repository#28879, ocaml/opam-repository#28893, and others, aligning with repository archiving governance
  • Data format diversity shown through new JSON Feed (ocaml/opam-repository#28884), Apache Avro (ocaml/opam-repository#28910), Protocol Buffers (ocaml/opam-repository#28902), and Crockford Base32 (ocaml/opam-repository#28885) implementations
  • Web development tooling advancement through Melange 6.0.0 (ocaml/opam-repository#28866), ojs_base 0.9.0 suite (ocaml/opam-repository#28882), and static site generation tools (raga ocaml/opam-repository#28847, handlebars-ml ocaml/opam-repository#28846)
  • Specialized domain coverage expanding from quantum computing (qcaml ocaml/opam-repository#28840) to legal programming (Catala 1.0.0 ocaml/opam-repository#28853) to fitness data (fit ocaml/opam-repository#28904)
entry.summary: OPAM 2.5.0~beta1 released with 43 packages merged including Catala 1.0.0, WebAssembly tooling, and cross-platform improvements

entry.title: Week 45, 2025: Package ecosystem growth with 35+ new releases and comprehensive platform documentation covering all OCaml compilation targets
entry.content:
New Features

  • Flux streaming library (ocaml/opam-repository#28804) by Calascibetta Romain introduces composable streaming abstractions with Miou for concurrent programming
  • Elpi 3.4.3 (ocaml/opam-repository#28832) by Enrico Tassi provides embeddable λProlog interpreter with updated language features and improved performance
  • ppxexpectnobase 0.17.3.0 (ocaml/opam-repository#28790) by Dmitrii Kosarev delivers cram-like testing framework with stripped dependencies for lighter-weight testing
  • Binaryen bindings series (ocaml/opam-repository#28817, ocaml/opam-repository#28819, ocaml/opam-repository#28821, ocaml/opam-repository#28822, ocaml/opam-repository#28823, ocaml/opam-repository#28824, ocaml/opam-repository#28809) by Oscar Spencer adds OCaml bindings for binaryen versions 0.28.0 through 0.31.0 and libbinaryen 122.0.0 through 124.0.0
  • Core library updates by Daniel Bünzli including bytesrw 0.3.0 with cryptographic random module (ocaml/opam-repository#28836), logs 0.10.0 with mutex safety improvements (ocaml/opam-repository#28838), topkg 1.1.1 (ocaml/opam-repository#28833), and cmarkit 0.4.0 with CommonMark 0.31.2 support (ocaml/opam-repository#28811)
